intro: Casearia celtidifolia, commonly known as the Brazilian beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that are followed by bright red, fleshy berries. These berries are edible and often consumed by birds, aiding in seed dispersal. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
